overview: This Act appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the kauhale initiative. [1] It also creates the supportive housing special fund to assist the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects for special needs individuals or families. [1] Additionally, the Act creates a kauhale initiative special fund to assist the statewide office of homelessness and housing solutions to implement the kauhale initiative. [1]
appropriations: The bill appropriates out of general revenues $50,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative. [CHUNK_17, NUMBER_5] It also appropriates $12,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027 to be deposited into the supportive housing special fund. [CHUNK_38, CHUNK_39, NUMBER_6, NUMBER_7] From the supportive housing special fund, $12,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for each fiscal year 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 for projects, with $189,750 (HB431_.HTM.txt) of that amount for one temporary full-time equivalent position. [CHUNK_40, CHUNK_41, NUMBER_7, NUMBER_8]
assumptions_and_methodology: The document does not specify the methodology used to determine the appropriation amounts. [1] The appropriations are intended for the continued implementation and operation of the kauhale initiative, building on previous programs like the ohana zones pilot program. [1] [1] The purpose of the funding is to address Hawaii's high homelessness rate by developing long-term solutions and creating affordable housing. [1] [1] [1]
agency_impact: The Hawaii housing finance and development corporation will administer the supportive housing special fund and establish one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I position. [1] [1] The sums appropriated for the kauhale initiative shall be expended by the office of the governor, which may transfer funds to other executive branch departments or agencies, including the statewide office on homelessness and housing solutions. [1] [1] The statewide office on homelessness and housing solutions will administer the kauhale initiative special fund. [1]
economic_impact: The bill is designed to address individuals with special housing needs, including those with addiction, transitioning from incarceration, youth aging out of foster care, and other vulnerable populations. [1] The kauhale initiative aims to create deeply affordable spaces for housing and healing the houseless. [1] Creating a new financing tool for supportive housing will enable the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation to facilitate the development of supportive housing units in stand-alone projects or integrated in mixed-income rental housing projects. [1]
policy_impact: This Act amends Chapter 201H, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by establishing a supportive housing special fund. [1] It also amends Chapter 346, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by establishing a kauhale initiative special fund. [1] The bill also establishes one temporary full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I position within the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation. [1]
revenue_sources: Appropriations are made from the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [1] [1] The supportive housing special fund may include sums appropriated by the legislature, private contributions, proceeds from repayment of loans, interest, fees, other returns, and moneys from other sources. [1] [1] The kauhale initiative special fund may also include sums appropriated by the legislature, program revenues, private contributions, interest, and moneys from other sources. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The bill provides appropriations for a two-year period, fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. [1] It appropriates $50,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) from general revenues for each of the two fiscal years for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative. [CHUNK_17, NUMBER_5] These sums shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal biennium. [1] For the supportive housing special fund, the bill appropriates $12,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) from general revenues for deposit in FY 2025-2026 and the same sum in FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_38, CHUNK_39, NUMBER_6, NUMBER_7] From this special fund, $12,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for expenditure in each of those two fiscal years. [CHUNK_40, NUMBER_7] This includes $189,750 (HB431_.HTM.txt) each year for one temporary full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I position. [CHUNK_41, NUMBER_8] The document does not provide a fiscal outlook beyond these two years. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The Hawaii housing finance and development corporation may establish, revise, charge, and collect a reasonable service fee in connection with its financing, services, and approvals. [1] These fees shall be deposited into the supportive housing special fund. [1] The kauhale initiative special fund may include program revenues as a source of funds. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: Moneys in the supportive housing special fund may be used to make loans to finance the development, pre-development, construction, acquisition, preservation, or substantial rehabilitation of supportive housing projects. [1] Act 128, Session Laws of Hawaii 2019, previously appropriated $2,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) for the construction of modular temporary units and renovation of existing structures. [CHUNK_4, NUMBER_1] No specific capital expenditures are detailed for the current appropriations. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The bill does not specify fiscal implications beyond the two-year appropriation period. [1] However, the establishment of the supportive housing special fund and the kauhale initiative special fund suggests an ongoing need for funding to support these initiatives. [1] [1] These funds are designed to receive future appropriations, private contributions, and other moneys to continue their work. [1] [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: No previous fiscal note was provided in the source documents. [1]
fte_positions: The bill establishes one temporary full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I within the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation. [1] This position is intended to help with the administration of the supportive housing special fund. [1] The appropriation for this position is $189,750 (HB431_.HTM.txt) for each of fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 out of the supportive housing special fund. [CHUNK_41, NUMBER_8]
appropriations_changes: No previous version of the bill was provided to identify changes in appropriations. [1]
funding_sources_changes: No previous version of the bill was provided to identify changes in funding sources. [1]
department_impact: The sums appropriated for the kauhale initiative are to be expended by the office of the governor. [1] The governor may transfer appropriations to other executive branch departments, including the statewide office on homelessness and housing solutions. [1] The sum appropriated from the supportive housing special fund is to be expended by the Hawaii Housing finance and development corporation. [1]
reports_required: The Hawaii housing finance and development corporation shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session describing the projects funded using moneys from the supportive housing special fund. [1] The statewide office on homelessness and housing solutions shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session describing the deposits to and uses of moneys from the kauhale initiative special fund. [1]
pilot_program: This bill does not establish a new pilot program. [1] It continues and expands initiatives that evolved from previous pilot programs, such as the ohana zones pilot program and a 2023 supportive housing pilot program. [1] [1] The bill establishes permanent special funds to support the ongoing kauhale initiative and the development of supportive housing. [1] [1]
sunset_date: The provided text of the bill does not include a sunset date. [1]
effective_date: This Act shall take effect on June 29, 2025. [1] However, sections 2, 5, and 6, which contain the appropriations, shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [1]
